title: Business Live: US markets soar - BBC News
summary: nasdaq and s & p 500 touch highs .
oil prices rise in lower inventories .
bank of england staff to vote on strike .
us paint maker drops akzo nobel bid .

documents.title: good night
text: and on that bombshell , thank you for following business live today .
we look forward to you joining us bright ( ish ) and early on friday at 6.00am for all the breaking business and economics news .

documents.title: sir richard branson : 'a very sad day for america '
text: virgin group founder sir richard branson says that donald trump 's decision to pull the us out of the paris climate accord is a `` very sad day '' for america and says it is now up to businesses to drive change .

documents.title: peabody energy closes lower
text: with trump 's announcement on withdrawing from the climate change deal widely expected , yesterday actually saw shares in peabody energy , the us 's largest publicly traded coal company fall by 2.2 % .
and following the confirmation today peabody shares fell another 0.6 % .

documents.title: paris accord : al gore reacts
text: former us vice president and environmentalist al gore says :

documents.title: us stock markets close at record highs
text: the us stock markets have welcomed us president donald trump 's decision to pull america out of the paris climate accord , with markets closing at new highs .
the s & p 500 has closed up 18.19 points at a record high of 2,429.99 .
the nasdaq also hit a fresh record at 6,246.83 , after rising 48.31 points .
the dow jones industrial average finished 133.81 points higher at 21,142.46 .

documents.title: breakingoil prices fall
text: brent crude is down 0.5 % at $ 50.50 a barrel .
west texas intermediate has fallen 0.2 % to $ 48.21 a barrel .

documents.title: trump : accord could cost america 2.7m jobs
text: us president donald trump claims that compliance with the terms of the paris accord `` could cost america as much as 2.7m lost jobs by 2025 '' .

documents.title: trump : here to represent pittsburgh , not paris
text: `` i was elected to represent the citizens of pittsburgh , not paris , '' says donald trump to a round of applause .

documents.title: breakingus markets soars on paris accord withdrawal
text: the dow jones industrial average has soared 109.73 points to 21,118.38 following the us president 's decision to pull america out of the paris climate accord .
the s & p 500 is up 14.44 points to 2,426.24 .
the nasdaq rises 39.78 points to 6,238.29 .

documents.title: us will begin talks on new climate deal
text: donald trump said the us will start talks to make a better climate deal .

documents.title: breakingtrump pulls us out of paris accord
text: us president donald trump has officially announced that the world 's largest economy will withdraw from the paris climate accord .
the paris agreement means nations will help to keep global temperature rises well under 2c .
the us contributes about 15 % of global emissions of carbon .

documents.title: us economy coming back 'very , very rapidly '
text: us president donald trump is now speaking .
he wants to talk about the `` tremendous '' progress the new administration has made with the us economy which he says is coming back `` very , very rapidly '' .

documents.title: oil prices tick upwards
text: the price of oil has risen a little .
brent crude is up 0.4 % to $ 50.95 a barrel following data which showed a higher than expected fall in us oil inventories in the week to 26 may .
west texas intermediate is also ahead , up 0.7 % at $ 48.64 .

documents.title: trump 'set to pull us out of paris accord '
text: it is looking like us president donald trump is going to withdraw the us from the paris climate accord .
cnn reports that the white house has begun informing members of congress that the us will step back from the agreement .
read here what it means if the us withdraws .

documents.title: is fred the shred heading for the dock ?
text: rbs 's former boss fred goodwin could appear in court , if a small group of investors get their way .

reuters reports that while a large number of shareholders have accepted an out-of-court settlement with the bank over a £ 12bn rights issue during the financial crisis , a faction is seeking more time to raise £ 7m for a trial .
the rbos shareholder action group has accepted a settlement of 82p a share , compared to the 200p-230p shareholders paid at the time of the fund-raising .
the breakaway group wants an extra 20p .

documents.title: linde and praxair win board approval for mega-merger
text: the boards of industrial gas giants linde and praxair have voted to approve a $ 73bn merger to rival french competitor air liquide .
the new company will be incorporated in ireland but governance activities such as board meetings will mainly take place in the uk .

documents.title: fed sets date for us bank stress test results
text: the us federal reserve will release the results of tests on banks ' capital strength later this month .
will these be the last that america 's financial sector will have to go through under the dodd-frank bank rules ?
results of 2017 dodd-frank stress tests to be released 6/22 at 4:30pm ; ccar results to be released 6/28 at 4:30pm :

documents.title: how would you help small businesses ?
text: the panel was asked how they would help small businesses in bedford .
mohammad yassin ( labour ) said : `` we would ensure a better workforce and put more money into education and training , something which the conservative have not done .
`` we would also ask the council to provide lower business rates [ but the council has been hit by ] £ 35m of cuts .
we need more money . ''
richard fuller ( conservative ) said : `` since i became mp i have tried to increase the number of small businesses in bedfordshire and the number has increased dramatically .
`` we should focus together on how to get measures to maintain lower rates and supporting people who run businesses . ''
henry vann ( lib dem ) said : `` the first thing i would do is block the conservative plan to make small businesses do quarterly tax returns .
`` the conservatives are only talking about deregulation . ''
lucy bywater ( green party ) said : `` we would support small businesses because we believe in local communities and the local economy .
`` we 'd give extra help to start-up companies . ''
she said she was concerned that amazon was paying too little tax compared with local firms in bedford .

documents.title: us factory activity rises
text: us stock markets have undoubtedly been boosted by stronger economic data on thursday .
the institute for supply management reports that its index of national factory activity rose to a reading of 54.9 in may from 54.8 in april .
a reading above 50 indicates an expansion in manufacturing , which accounts for about 12 % of the us economy .
chris rupkey , chief economist at mufg , tells reuters : `` the economy is moving forward at an acceptable pace and the fed is likely to hike rates in june . ''
but he adds : `` there is a cloud over the path of rates later on this year . ''

documents.title: where now for the pound ?
text: prime minister theresa may called the general election on 18 april and here is how the pound has performed against the dollar since then .
polls showing the gap between the conservative party and labour narrowing have weighed on sterling in recent days .
you can read all the up-to-date poll information here .
so , what now for sterling ?
`` the markets have certainly stabilised , '' says kathleen brooks , research director at city index .
`` we 're very much range-bound in the pound as we lead up to this election so it suggests that there 's such a disparity in the polls that the market is not taking one poll as truth . ''
some analysts are turning their attention to post-election brexit talks .
investment bank credit agricole said : `` the uk is facing a hard brexit and a very uncertain political period ahead .
although undervalued , we think sterling will remain weak to compensate for the loss of access to the single market . ''

documents.title: ballot box blues for house prices
text: uk house prices have fallen for three consecutive months for the first time since 2009 , according to building society nationwide .
but martyn baum , former president of the national association of estate agents , says the slowdown can be explained by there being a general election around the corner .
`` we saw it before the referendum and we see it before general elections , '' he told 5 live .
`` people take a bit of 'let 's wait and see approach ' for a big decision in their life . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

text: business journalists ' favourite economic commentator , howard archer , has left ihs markit and is joining the ey item club

documents.title: s & p 500 hits new record
text: following the lead of the nasdaq , the s & p has now reached an all-time high of 2,420.67 after rising by 8.87 points .

she says that she regards the paris accord as an important agreement and is pleased that many other governments see it that way .

documents.title: breakingsouthern rail workers suspend overtime ban
text: a ban on working overtime at southern railways has been suspended for two weeks .
the train drivers ' union aslef says the cessation will allow a number of issues to be discussed with management , including finding a resolution to the dispute over driver-only trains .

mick whelan , general secretary of aslef , says : `` the company has indicated that it is prepared to negotiate with us on a range of outstanding issues and , therefore , we have suspended our overtime ban .
`` we now have a fortnight to try and find a resolution which will work for passengers , for staff , and for the company , too . ''

documents.title: final prices for london
text: the ftse 100 finished thursday higher , but not at a new record .
the blue chip index rose 23.82 points to 7,543.77 .
bookmaker paddy power led the risers , up 4.34 % at £ 84.20 .
housebuilder taylor wimpey was the biggest faller , down 6.45 % at 190p .
the ftse 250 closed up 38.45 points at 20,010.62 .

documents.title: dow jones reverses fall
text: the dow jones industrial average is now up flip-flopping earlier on thursday and is trading 30.16 points ahead at 21,038.81 .
figures from payrolls processor adp showed that employers had added 253,000 jobs last month .
on friday , us non-farm payrolls will show how many new positions were created in may .

randy frederick , vice president of trading and derivatives for charles schwab , says : `` the adp numbers were good today and often times , but not always , they are a good indication of the monthly jobs data . ''
however , some are doubtful about the data .
`` take this morning 's estimate from adp with a huge grain of salt , '' said john herrmann , rates strategist at mufg securities americas .

documents.title: london markets close up
text: trading on the ftse indexes has finished for today .
the ftse 100 has closed up 27.78 points at 7,547.73 .
the ftse 250 finished up 42.73 points at 20,014.90 .
business live will return with the final reading once all the trades have been settled .

documents.title: reality check : the minimum wage pledges
text: reality check : the minimum wage pledges

documents.title: falling inventories lift oil prices
text: american oil stocks fell by 6.2m in the week to 26 june , according to the energy information administration , against expectations of a 2.5m barrel drop .
the data has lifted brent crude by 0.35 % to $ 50.94 a barrel .
west texas intermediate rose by 0.56 % to $ 48.59 .

documents.title: sometimes tax does need to be taxing
text: david beckham and other celebrities lose £ 700m tax case

documents.title: pound edges down on closing election gap
text: the pound is currently trading 0.02 % lower against the dollar at $ 1.2888 as one poll shows that the gap between the conservatives and labour is closing following wednesday 's general election debate .
as we head towards voting day on 8 june , charles hepworth , investment director at asset manager gam , says that the markets are assuming that theresa may is going to win .
but he says : `` if recent volatility in sterling signals anything , then mrs may should be more worried than she is currently showing .
`` if the latest polls are any indication of the likely result , a smaller-than-expected tory majority would be a clear disappointment for markets . ''

documents.title: oil prices struggle to settle
text: brent crude continues to flutter around the $ 50 a barrel mark .
on thursday it is trading 0.2 % lower at $ 50.65 .

like yesterday , west texas intermediate has already broken through that level but is 0.1 % up at $ 48.36 after new data showed that us inventories of oil fell by 8.7m barrels to 513.2m in the week to 26 may .
it has been forecast to decline by 2.5m .
stephen brennock , analyst at pvm oil associates , says : `` this was well ahead of forecasts .
( it ) is helping the oil market regain some ground . ''

documents.title: getting the balance right
text: it 's a decade since marks & spencer 's launched plan a to tackle climate change .
and on thursday , the company announced a new initiative - this time to help communities , including fixing the skills shortage among the young .
but how does that square with m & s 's proposal to close stores in some areas ?
all the staff in those shops have been `` offered continuity of employment '' , and it 's also opening food stores in other areas , m & s boss steve rowe tells colletta smith on 5 live .
the retailer has also moved many staff onto new contracts .
however .
some long-serving employees say they 're worse off .
mr rowe says m & s was `` committed to making sure our people are paid at the highest levels in retail - and they are '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: eu fires warning shot at us steel probe
text: the tension between the eu and the trump administration continues .
this time it relates to an investigation into exports of cheap steel into the us .

reuters reports that the european commission has written to the us department of commerce stating that the probe should be limited to issues of national security and not result in restrictive measures against nations which export steel to america .

documents.title: watch : 'britain needs better connectivity '
text: as part of the bbc 's election coverage , wake up to money has been travelling around the country speaking to people on their way to and from work about the election issues that matter to them .
tony bonsignore heard that poor internet coverage and rising business rates are among the concerns .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: dow jones dips
text: from a brief rise on opening , the dow jones industrial average is down 4.35 points at 21,004.30 .
the nasdaq , however , is still ahead , up 17.36 points at 6215.88 .
the s & p 500 is up 2.15 points at 2,413.95 .

documents.title: gm sales fall amid shift cuts
text: car sales at general motors ( gm ) fell by 1.3 % in may and the us car maker has announced plans to eliminate one of two shifts at its michigan transmission plant .
the company has already been cutting shifts elsewhere , leading to job losses of around 5,000 in ohio and michigan .
gm told cnbc : `` recent actions to reduce passenger car production have caused us to adjust transmission production .
`` this action will help maintain more stable production and provide the smallest impact to plant employment going forward . ''

documents.title: nasdaq hits a new record
text: it is a brighter day on the us stock markets so far .
the nasdaq has touched a new record again , rising 19.67 points to 6,218.18 .
the dow jones industrial average has opened 18.72 points higher at 21,027.37 .
the s & p 500 is 4.25 points ahead at 2,416.05 .

documents.title: ford beats may sales forecast
text: new car sales for may are beginning to emerge from the us .
ford , which announced jim hackett as its new chief executive last month , reports that domestic car sales rose by 2.2 % compared to forecasts of 2 % .

documents.title: watch : a new career for kamal ?
text: the bbc 's economics editor kamal ahmed was welcomed into the kitchens at mcdonald 's .
see how he got on

documents.title: iod : we 're 'slipping behind the eu ' on brexit detail
text: the deputy director of policy at the institute of directors ( iod ) has said `` we still know very little about what the major parties actually want '' from the final brexit deal .
edwin morgan told martha kearney the eu had offered a `` much more detailed process and outlines '' .
referring to leaders not wanting to give away their negotiating hand , mr morgan said `` it 's not going to be possible practically to keep everything a secret '' .
author: The World at One
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'cut national insurance payments '
text: with only a week left until polling day , we 've been hearing from uk business leaders about what they want from the next government .
jodie cook , founder of birmingham-based jc social media , wants firms ' national insurance contributions reduced to encourage them to hire new staff .
author: Election 2017

documents.title: us adds more jobs than expected in may
text: ahead of key us employment figures tomorrow , payrolls processor adp says the world 's largest economy added 253,000 jobs in may , well ahead of economists ' estimates of 185,000 .
on friday , new non-farm payroll data is forecast to show that employment grew by 160,000 last month , compared to 211,000 in april .

documents.title: ftse 'could have been higher '
text: the ftse is trading at just over the 7,550 mark but financial analyst connor campbell at spreadex reckons it would have potentially been higher if it were not for the mining stocks .

he points out that following the news that chinese manufacturing contracted last month the likes of anglo american and bhp billiton found themselves in the red , preventing the ftse from matching wednesday 's intraday record .

documents.title: uber and out ?
text: uber 's head of finance , gautam gupta , is leaving the company , the third senior executive the transport company has lost this week .
uber said losses narrowed in the first three months of 2017 to $ 708m ( £ 549m ) from $ 991m in the previous quarter .
the company does not report financial results publicly , but said it was `` on a good trajectory towards profitability '' .
in recent months it has been rocked by scandal , high-profile sackings and allegations of sexism .
read more here

documents.title: brazil exits its longest recession
text: brazil has ended its longest recession in history as the country 's economy expanded by 1 % in the first three months of 2017 , officials announced on thursday .
it ends a spell of two consecutive years of negative growth , when the brazilian economy shrank by almost 8 % .
despite the end of technical recession , there are doubts about the future prospects of the brazilian economy .
some analysts believe the country could still face negative growth in the near future .
a new corruption scandal is throwing economic reforms into doubt and raising questions about the future of president michel temer .

on wednesday brazilian authorities dropped the interest rate to 10.25 % ( from 11.25 % ) , but suggested the interest rate will now decrease at a lower pace than previously thought , as inflation expectations worsened with the new scandal .
earlier this week officials announced that unemployment had reached a new historic peak of 14 million people .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: should uk worry about g7 league ?
text: the uk came in last among g7 countries for economic growth in the first three months of the year .
but jonathan portes , professor of economics at king 's college london , does n't think you can read too much into it .
# despitebrexit warning : quarterly gdp growth figures do n't tell you much , & league tables still less
but there 's always someone and this tweet from mr hannan does n't look like it will age well .

documents.title: london shares ahead in midday trade
text: let 's get an update on what 's happening to shares in london this lunchtime .
the ftse 100 has lost a bit of ground over the course of the morning , but it 's still ahead at 7,551.04 , that 's a rise of 32 points or 0.41 % .
bus and rail operator first group saw its share price tumble 5.6 % in thursday morning trading after giving a cautious trading outlook .
it was the biggest loser on the ftse 250 , despite reporting a 23 % rise in pre-tax profits to £ 207m for the year to the end of march .
the ftse 250 was at 20,013.33 , that 's a gain of 41 points or 0.21 % .

documents.title: brexit and trade
text: brexit and trade

documents.title: willie walsh backs ba boss
text: willie walsh , the head of british airways owner iag , has backed the ba boss in his first interview since the it fiasco that grounded flights last weekend .
he said alex cruz , the british airways chief executive , had done a great job .
mr walsh said he doubted anyone could have managed the challenge better and that mr cruz did well to get planes back in the air as quickly as he did .
hre 's

documents.title: 'insure my dinosaur '
text: insurer aviva has given examples of some of the unusual requests made by its wealthier clients .
they include an enquiry about insurance cover for a decommissioned mig fighter jet kept in the back garden , and a premium for covering a life-size fibreglass model of a brontosaurus .
`` it can be difficult putting a value on a one-off item , like a life-size brontosaurus , '' says richard alger , of aviva , in a sentence you do n't hear every day .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: iag boss : repeats ba chaos 'not it problem'bbc transport correspondent tweets
text: iag boss : repeats ba chaos 'not it problem'bbc transport correspondent tweets

documents.title: ba owner 's long haul budget airline takes off
text: the owner of british airways , iag , said its new trans-atlantic budget airline will expand its fleet to five planes and aims to open new european bases .
barcelona-based level will initially use two new airbus a330 aircraft to serve the americas , with fares starting from £ 99 one-way .
its first flight from barcelona to los angeles takes off on thursday .
it will be followed by flights to san francisco , buenos aires and the dominican republic in the coming weeks .
read more here

documents.title: peer-to-peer lender raises £ 32m
text: the uk 's first peer-to-peer lending site has raised £ 32m from investors as it prepares to apply for a bank licence later this year .
zopa links savers directly with borrowers - bypassing the banking system .
it started in 2005 , but has grown rapidly in the past 12 months - facilitating over £ 800m in personal loans to uk consumers since june 2016 .

to help the company grow further , the new investors include indian finance group wadhawan global capital - which will join zopa 's board - and early spotify backer northzone , a european venture capital fund .

documents.title: ready for their close-up
text: business presenter sean farrington was at england 's biggest rural life festival talking to farmers about what they want to see from next week 's election .
normally , the advice is do n't work with kids and animals - but the exception seems to be when the animals are being groomed for a show
the animals @ twitterid have a rigorous morning grooming routine !
thanks for hosting us this morning for @ twitterid @ twitterid
sales of tattersall check shirts have soared

documents.title: what happened with dulux takeover battle ?
text: the decision by us paint maker ppg industries not to make a formal bid for dulux owner akzo nobel calls time on an increasingly bitter takeover tussle .
ppg made three informal offers for akzo , only to see all three swiftly rejected by the dutch firm 's management as unwanted and undervalued .
the battle moved to the courts , and earlier this week , a dutch judge rejected attempts by a group of shareholders to force a special shareholder meeting aimed at ousting akzo 's chairman .
ppg boss michael mcgarry revealed this morning that it had made one last attempt at opening talks with akzo last week - but that its call and letter fell on deaf ears .
`` as a result , we believe it is in the best interests of ppg and its shareholders to withdraw our proposal to akzonobel at this time , '' he said .

documents.title: dulux owner 'notes bid withdrawal '
text: akzo nobel , which owns dulux paint , has acknowledged the decision of us rival ppg industries to drop its contentious takeover bid .
akzo chief ton büchner said the company would now focus on its own plan for growing the business , which involves spinning off its chemicals division and returning more money to shareholders .

`` we continue to focus on our business , pursuing our strategy of accelerating sustainable growth and profitability and creating two focused , high-performing businesses - paints and coatings and specialty chemicals , '' he said .

documents.title: a striking thought
text: a bit more on the potential strike over employee pay at the bank of england .
the 323-year-old central bank , led by governor mark carney , is best known for setting interest rates .
but it 's a big employer in its own right - with a staff of about 3,600 - and has many other functions including regulating banks and monitoring the health of the economy .
the sun 's deputy political editor tweets :
unite is launching a strike ballot over pay - at the bank of england !
( only among facilities staff , not mr carney )
cleaners etc ?

documents.title: breakingppg walks away from dulux owner
text: ppg industries will not make a formal bid for dulux owner akzo nobel after repeated informal offers were rejected , the us paint maker said on thursday .
under dutch takeover law , ppg can not approach akzo again for six months .
the us firm had proposed a takeover deal worth about 26bn euros .
akzo shares fell 1 % following the announcement .

documents.title: export growth 'slows '
text: uk manufacturing grew again in may - albeit at a slower pace than the month before , according to a survey of factory orders .
the ihs markit purchasing managers index found that the growth largely came from higher domestic demand rather than increased exports - as the nifty chart below indicates .

rob dobson , senior economist at ihs markit , also explains : `` growth of new export business played a lesser role in comparison , with the trend in foreign demand continuing to improve only in fits and starts , despite the assistance of a historically weak sterling exchange rate . ''
uk manufacturing pmi showed export growth weakened in may , but still robust

documents.title: eu agrees monte dei paschi deal
text: the european commission has reached an agreement in principle with italian authorities over a recapitalisation of beleaguered lender banca monte dei paschi di siena .

the commission said it had agreed the `` precautionary recapitalisation '' of the bank in line with eu rules , provided that certain criteria were met such as making sure the bank becomes profitable .
the bank failed an eu stress test last year july because of billions of euros of risky loans on its books , made to clients who can not afford to repay them .
this solution is a positive step forward for monte paschi di siena ( mps ) and the italian banking sector .
it would allow italy to inject capital into mps as a precaution , in line with eu rules , whilst limiting the burden on italian taxpayers .
mps will undergo deep restructuring to ensure its viability , including by cleaning its balance sheet from non-performing loans .
i hope this will enable mps to focus on lending to the italian businesses and support the italian economy .

documents.title: ba computer crash : the unanswered questions
text: as senior figures at ba push for an inquiry into the bank holiday chaos , bbc transport correspondent richard westcott looks at the unanswered questions .
he writes :
`` certainly up until a while ago , british airways ' it systems had a variety of safety nets in place to get things back on their feet quickly if there was any problem .
`` i 'm assuming those safety nets are still there , so why did they fail ?
and did human error play a part in all this ?

`` if ba wants to repair its reputation , its owner iag needs to convince the public that making hundreds of it staff redundant last year did not leave them woefully short of experts who could have fixed the meltdown sooner .
and that it wo n't happen again - at least not on this epic scale . ''
read more on richard 's findings here .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: 'disgraceful snub '
text: the ballot on industrial action at the bank of england is thought to involve fewer than 2 % of staff .

initially , staff working in maintenance , reception and facilities departments , who unite says can earn `` as little as £ 20,000 '' , will receive the ballot papers asking whether they want to take `` industrial action or action short of strike action '' .
the bank of england refused to comment .
staff at the bank of england will today start voting for industrial action due to their employers outright refusal to negotiate a fair pay deal for its workforce .
the bank 's disgraceful snub of low paid staff stinks of arrogance and represents an organisation thoroughly out of touch with the reality of the pressure staff face meeting their costs of living .

documents.title: bank of england staff to vote on industrial action
text: staff at the bank of england ( boe ) will begin voting on thursday on whether to take industrial action , the unite union says .
the ballot comes because staff are `` angry that they have been give a below inflation pay offer for the second year running '' , according to unite .
the boe pay `` pot '' will increase by 1 % for the pay year which began in march .

unite says because the amount that an individual will receive is then decided at the discretion of line managers , `` employees could receive less than one per cent and some will receive no rise at all '' .
unite - which represents boe staff in security , catering , legal , human resources and other services - said the pay offer was `` derisory '' and called the bank `` arrogant and out of touch '' .
the ballot is due to close on 21 june .

documents.title: breakinguk factories keep up growth
text: britain 's manufacturing sector grew for the tenth month in a row in may , according to a closely watched survey .
the purchasing managers index for manufacturing fell to 56.7 , but was only slightly below april 's three-year high of 57.3 .
anything above 50 indicates growth .

duncan brock of the chartered institute of procurement & supply , said : while not quite hitting the heights of april 's rebound in activity , the manufacturing sector did n't disappoint with a sustained rise in purchasing activity , output and new orders , optimism at a 20-month high , and storming ahead unfazed by the looming election . ''

documents.title: housing outlook 'uncertain '
text: nationwide 's chief economist robert gardner told today the outlook for house prices was `` uncertain '' .
`` a lot is going to depend on what happens to the economy , '' he said .

`` but we , along with most people , think that the economy probably will slow over the rest of the year as the squeeze on household incomes intensifies and that will probably spill over into lower activity in the housing market .
`` but we do think it will be fairly modest and if you think of prices there 's still quite a lot of support for house prices .
so mortgage rates are close to all-time lows and the supply side of the market is still very constrained .

`` so if you look at the number of properties on the market that 's still close to 30-year-lows so we still think prices are probably going to increase over 2017 as a whole by around about 2 % - but we recognise a lot will depend on what happens to the wider economy and that 's very uncertain , '' he concluded .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'let 's see what trump does on paris accord '
text: president trump is preparing to announce later today if the us will - as widely reported - withdraw from the paris accord on climate change .
what will the uk do if he goes ahead with that plan ?
boris johnson says that first `` let 's see what he does '' .
donald trump has largely `` migrated into a general area of reasonableness and common sense '' since taking office , he tells 5 live breakfast .
but either way , most of the work on tackling emissions is done at a state level in the us , not just at a federal level in washington , he adds .
separately , on the issue of theresa may missing last night 's election debate , the foreign secretary says she was `` absolutely right not to go '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: the uber of laundry ?
text: uber is often trotted out by business executives as a byword for tech 's ability to disrupt well-established sectors , after shaking up the taxi industry worldwide .
but we might well have seen that metaphor being stretched as far as it 'll go .
ed relf , the founder & chief executive of a clothes cleaning app , says his company is the `` uber of laundry '' .
we know what he means , but it kind of conjures up images of dirty socks and t-shirts being driven around the streets of the uk .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: productivity is key to pay
text: richard jeffrey , chief economist of cazenove capital management agrees that productivity is key to why pay growth remains under pressure .
`` people get paid more in real terms because they 're able to produce more and you 've got to follow this back through the economic chain , '' he told today .

`` if people are going to be able to produce more then companies have to invest in the right equipment for that to be enabled and it 's the low rates of growth in capital investment that we 're seeing in the economy which are the real concern and the real reason why real pay is not rising quickly , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: keep calm and carry on
text: more on the news that house prices dipped for the third month running in may .
robert gardner , nationwide 's chief economist , was on today .
`` there are definitely signs that the housing market is losing momentum .
we have seen morgage approvals dip to a seven month low in april , we have seen house price growth soften in the last couple of months , '' he said .
`` but at this stage its definitely a moderation .
i do n't think we should get overly excited at this point , '' he added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse 100 ahead at open
text: the ftse 100 has opened higher within the past few minutes - it 's at 7,551.26 , that 's a rise of 31 points or 0.42 % .
it was little changed at 7,519.95 at wednesday 's close .
may was the strongest month so far this year for the index .
